analysis.Summary: SearchForm.vue defines a reusable search input component with a search icon, clear icon, and event emission when the user submits or clears the search query.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a stylized, reactive search input that syncs an initial value, emits a 'search' event on submit, and allows clearing the current query while maintaining focus.

Components.name: SearchForm
Components.role: Root component defined in this file; manages searchQuery state, handles user actions, and emits events.

Components.name: Button
Components.role: Renders a clickable button used here for clearing the search input.

Components.name: IconSearch
Components.role: Displays a search icon at the start of the input.

Components.name: IconCross
Components.role: Displays a cross icon inside the clear button to reset the input.

Functions.name: handleSearch
Functions.description: Called when the user presses Enter in the input. Emits a 'search' event with the trimmed query if not empty.

Functions.name: clearSearch
Functions.description: Clears the searchQuery state and returns focus to the input field.

analysis.Usage: Import SearchForm.vue in a parent component and use it as <SearchForm :placeholder="'Find tracks...'" :initialQuery="query" @search="onSearch"/>. Listen to the 'search' event to perform searches.
Notes: Uses watchEffect to keep internal searchQuery in sync when initialQuery prop changes.
Scoped CSS provides background transition and focus-within styles for visual feedback.
The clear button hides itself when the query is empty and disables loader/success indicators.
Input placeholder color and focus outline are customized via CSS variables and pseudo-classes.
Leverages Vue 3 <script setup> syntax for concise component definition.
